intro: Malvastrum howellii var. cordatum, commonly known as the heartleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species in arid landscapes.
